oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jesus Name Tradition funeral and serpent bite home movie, 1974 June
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Vance, Mary
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording begins with a short service. Followed by home footage of children handling a small serpent. Some children are forcing another child to handle a serpent. Followed by home footage of Johnny Holbrook recovering from a serpent bite. There follows a service where members handle serpents, dance, and handle fire. Outside luncheon is held after service, where serpents are present. Another service is held. Men testify before the congregation. Male members cry and embrace each other. There follows additional home footage of Johnny Holbrook recovering from a serpent bite. Video ends with a funeral service where members dance with fire and a man is slain in the spirit.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Funeral rites and ceremonies; Slain in the Spirit; Snakebites; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Elledge, Larry; Holbrook, Johnny
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Baptism, Funeral, and Wedding home movies
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Mary Vance Jesus Name Tradition photographs and home movies
